verses.verse: And Balaam <WH1109> said <WH559> unto Balak <WH1111>, Build <WH1129> me here seven <WH7651> altars <WH4196>, and prepare <WH3559> me here seven <WH7651> oxen <WH6499> and seven <WH7651> rams <WH352>.
And Balak <WH1111> did <WH6213> as Balaam <WH1109> had spoken <WH1696>; and Balak <WH1111> and Balaam <WH1109> offered <WH5927> on every altar <WH4196> a bullock <WH6499> and a ram <WH352>.

And Balaam <WH1109> said <WH559> unto Balak <WH1111>, Stand <WH3320> by your burnt offering <WH5930>, and I will go <WH3212>: perhaps the Lord <WH3068> will come <WH7136> to meet <WH7125> me <WH1697>: and whatever he shows <WH7200> me I will tell <WH5046> you <WH3212>. And he went to an high place <WH8205>.

And God <WH430> met <WH7136> Balaam <WH1109>: and he said <WH559> unto him <WH6186>, I have prepared seven <WH7651> altars <WH4196>, and I have offered <WH5927> upon every altar <WH4196> a bullock <WH6499> and a ram <WH352>.
And the Lord <WH3068> put <WH7760> a word <WH1697> in Balaam <WH1109>'s mouth <WH6310>, and said <WH559>, Return <WH7725> unto Balak <WH1111>, and thus you shall speak <WH1696>.
And he returned <WH7725> unto him <WH5324>, and, behold, he stood by his burnt sacrifice <WH5930>, he <WH8269>, and all the princes of Moab <WH4124>.

And he took up <WH5375> his parable <WH4912>, and said <WH559>, Balak <WH1111> the king <WH4428> of Moab <WH4124> has brought <WH5148> me from Aram <WH758>, out of the mountains <WH2042> of the east <WH6924>, saying <WH3212>, Come, curse <WH779> me Jacob <WH3290>, and come <WH3212>, defy <WH2194> Israel <WH3478>.
How <WH4100> shall I curse <WH5344>, whom God <WH410> has not cursed <WH6895>? or how shall I defy <WH2194>, whom the Lord <WH3068> has not defied <WH2194>?

For from the top <WH7218> of the rocks <WH6697> I see <WH7200> him <WH1389>, and from the hills I behold <WH7789> him <WH5971>: behold, the people shall live <WH7931> alone <WH910>, and shall not be reckoned <WH2803> among the nations <WH1471>.

Who can count <WH4487> the dust <WH6083> of Jacob <WH3290>, and the number <WH4557> of the fourth <WH7255> part of Israel <WH3478>? Let me die <WH4191> the death <WH4194> of the righteous <WH3477>, and let my last end be like his <WH319>!

And Balak <WH1111> said <WH559> unto Balaam <WH1109>, What have you done <WH6213> unto me <WH3947>? I took you to curse <WH6895> my enemies <WH341>, and <WH1288>, behold, you have blessed them altogether <WH1288>.
And he answered <WH6030> and said <WH559>, Must I not take care <WH8104> to speak <WH1696> that which the Lord <WH3068> has put <WH7760> in my mouth <WH6310>?

And Balak <WH1111> said <WH559> unto him <WH3212>, Come, I pray you <WH312>, with me unto another place <WH4725>, from from where you may see <WH7200> them <WH7200>: you shall see but <WH657> the farthest <WH7097> part of them <WH7200>, and shall not see them all <WH6895>: and curse me them from there.

And he brought <WH3947> him into the field <WH7704> of Zophim <WH6839>, to the top <WH7218> of Pisgah <WH6449>, and built <WH1129> seven <WH7651> altars <WH4196>, and offered <WH5927> a bullock <WH6499> and a ram <WH352> on every altar <WH4196>.
And he said <WH559> unto Balak <WH1111>, Stand <WH3320> here <WH3541> by your burnt offering <WH5930>, while I meet <WH7136> the Lord yonder <WH3541>.
And the Lord <WH3068> met <WH7136> Balaam <WH1109>, and put <WH7760> a word <WH1697> in his mouth <WH6310>, and said <WH559>, Go again <WH7725> unto Balak <WH1111>, and say thus <WH1696>.

And when he came <WH935> to him <WH5324>, behold, he stood by his burnt offering <WH5930>, and the princes <WH8269> of Moab <WH4124> with him <WH1111>. And Balak said <WH559> unto him <WH3068>, What has the Lord spoken <WH1696>?
And he took up <WH5375> his parable <WH4912>, and said <WH559>, Rise up <WH6965>, Balak <WH1111>, and hear <WH8085>; listen <WH238> unto me <WH1121>, you son of Zippor <WH6834>:

God <WH410> is not a man <WH376>, that he should lie <WH3576>; neither the son <WH1121> of man <WH120>, that he should repent <WH5162>: has he said <WH559>, and shall he not do <WH6213> it <WH1696>? or has he spoken, and shall he not make it good <WH6965>?
Behold <WH3947>, I have received commandment to bless <WH1288>: and he has blessed <WH1288>; and I cannot reverse it <WH7725>.

He has not looked <WH5027> iniquity <WH205> in Jacob <WH3290>, neither has he seen <WH7200> perverseness <WH5999> in Israel <WH3478>: the Lord <WH3068> his God <WH430> is with him <WH8643>, and the shout of a king is among them <WH4428>.
God <WH410> brought them out <WH3318> of Egypt <WH4714>; he has as it were the strength <WH8443> of an unicorn <WH7214>.

Surely there is no enchantment <WH5173> against Jacob <WH3290>, neither is there any divination <WH7081> against Israel <WH3478>: according to this time <WH6256> it shall be said <WH559> of Jacob <WH3290> and of Israel <WH3478>, What has God <WH410> worked <WH6466>!

Behold <WH5971>, the people shall rise up <WH6965> as a great lion <WH3833>, and lift up <WH5375> himself as a young lion <WH738>: he shall not lie down <WH7901> until he eat <WH398> of the prey <WH2964>, and drink <WH8354> the blood <WH1818> of the slain <WH2491>.
And Balak <WH1111> said <WH559> unto Balaam <WH1109>, Neither curse <WH5344> them at all <WH6895>, nor bless <WH1288> them at all <WH1288>.
But Balaam <WH1109> answered <WH6030> and said <WH559> unto Balak <WH1111>, Told <WH1696> not I you <WH559>, saying, All that the Lord <WH3068> speaks <WH1696>, that I must do <WH6213>?

And Balak <WH1111> said <WH559> unto Balaam <WH1109>, Come <WH3212>, I pray you <WH3947>, I will bring you unto another <WH312> place <WH4725>; perhaps it will please <WH3474> God <WH430> that you may curse me them from there <WH6895>.
And Balak <WH1111> brought <WH3947> Balaam <WH1109> unto the top <WH7218> of Peor <WH6465>, that looks <WH8259> toward <WH6440> Jeshimon <WH3452>.

And Balaam <WH1109> said <WH559> unto Balak <WH1111>, Build <WH1129> me here seven <WH7651> altars <WH4196>, and prepare <WH3559> me here seven <WH7651> bullocks <WH6499> and seven <WH7651> rams <WH352>.
And Balak <WH1111> did <WH6213> as Balaam <WH1109> had said <WH559>, and offered <WH5927> a bullock <WH6499> and a ram <WH352> on every altar <WH4196>.
